Air Force One is taking off for Obama's 2-day, 8-state tour.

Joe Biden says couldn't tell from last night's debate whether @MittRomney wanted to oppose or endorse @BarackObama
@BarackObama is back at his hotel after a strong debate.
@BarackObama and @MittRomney and their families seem to be having a friendly conversation on the stage
Both @BarackObama and @MittRomney give strong closing statements at the final #debate.
@MittRomney mentions voters in Wisconsin and Pennsylvania at the debate in a play for those two states.
@MittRomney mentions the number of nuclear warheads that Britain has when talking about Pakistan.
@BarackObama namecheks his VP, Joe Biden, as not always agreeing with him on foreign policy. Does that make Biden look weak?
@BarackObama strategy on Romney: paint him as "all over the map" on foreign policy.
@BarackObama gives strong rebuttal about Israel trip, talks about going there as a candidate and notes he didn't bring donors on his trip.
@MittRomney explains to @BarackObama why he called the Potus trip an apology tour, and knocks him for not going to Israel.
#Obama doesn't use the word lie, but comes close. Says @MittRomney's accusation that he made an apology tour is biggest whopper of campaign
Obama says NyTimes report that US, Iran agreed in principle to one on one talks is not true.
Obama says Romney hasn't spent time looking at how military works. Says with condescension that US has things called aircraft carriers.
@MittRomney also turns the debate to a discussion of the economy, mentions high unemployment
@BarackObama finds a way to get auto industry (read: Ohio) into a foreign policy debate.
It's a competition of list-making! Both @BarackObama and @MittRomney are speaking in ones, twos, and threes to make their points.
Obama knocks Romney for saying Russia was the biggest U.S. geopolitical foe, says the Cold War has been over for years
@MittRomney seeks to neutralize Obama's having presided over the killing of Osama bin Laden, saying U.S. can't kill itself out of this mess
Body language: @BarackObama is looking closely at @MittRomney as he speaks, not looking down or at his notes.
Obama and Romney shake hands, lean heads very closely to each other as they come in to the debate hall.
The debate hall is completely silent, except for some TV folks. Tense waiting for the candidates to come in
@bobschieffer is telling the audience in the debate hall that he is honored to be the moderator.
@MichelleObama just took her seat in the debate hall, Looks like she's in the front row, on the left side.
A view of the debate hall from the back where pool reporters are sitting. http://t.co/ryrE80V5
@BarackObama has arrived at the debate site.
@BarackObama's motorcade is driving past some cheering supporters on the road to the university. So far, more Dems than Repubs are out.
Getting close to getting started. @BarackObama has left the hotel and is on the way to the debate site.
It's steak and potatoes again! A campaign aide for @BarackObama says he'll repeat the menu he had with wife Michelle before the last debate.
Air Force One has landed in Florida. Game on for @BarackObama.
@BarackObama has boarded AF1 and is headed to Florida for the final debate against Mitt Romney.
Two White House aides just high-fived as they boarded Air Force One.
Obama has finally left the debate site and headed to his helicopter, a good hour behind schedule.
@BarackObama must be pleased with how he did tonight. He lingered much longer on the stage afterwards and hasn't head to the airport yet.
It's' 10:30 p.m eastern. This debate is going into overtime, literally.
Romney also a little wordy at the end.
After being disciplined at being concise at the beginning of the debate, Obama gets a little less disciplined at the end.
Romney jabs Obama for going on a political trip right after the U.S. ambassador to Libya was killed.
Obama neutralized a potential attack from Romney by saying the buck stops with him on the Libya tragedy.
Obama is speaking in lists during this debate...a lot like Romney did in the first one.
Romney compares Obama unfavorably to Reagan on getting unemployment down. Red meat for his conservative base.
Romney reaches out to women, mentions poverty levels for women specifically.
Obama gets it in to the conversation that Romney makes $20 million a year
Clear strategy from Romney: keep mentioning middle class has been buried. He doesnt' need to quote Biden for people to know the allusion
Crowd laughs when Obama says conceivable that Romney could bring gas prices down because his policies would put the economy back in a mess
Romney just as feisty as Obama. Debate is getting testy.
Very clear tactic here from Obama. In his next rebuttal, he says again that very little that Romney said is true.
You can tell that Obama has practiced being concise. It's showing.
On energy, Obama says Romney will let oil and gas companies write U.S. energy policy. Gets an attack in right after going over his policy
Obama very feisty. Says Obama doesn't have a five point plan, he has a one point plan.
So much for no follow-ups. Candy Crowley asks a question right after the first questioner.
Obama, in a much more energetic style than last debate, goes through a lot of his talking points in his first answer. Energy. Cars. Taxes.
Obama gets into his first answer the fact that Gov. Romney said "Let Detoit go bankrupt."
Romney asks questioner, Jeremy, when he will graduate. 2014 is the answer. Romney says he expects to be president then.
Romney starts walking toward first questioner. He won coin toss, so gets to give the first answer.
Obama goes straight for his stool after shaking hands with Romney
CNN's Candy Crowley says her goal is to make sure questions at the debate get answered.
Pretty much complete silence in the debate hall as the crowd waits for the final three minutes before the canidates come on stage.
Crowd claps as Ann Romney and Michelle Obama are introduced
Former Clinton press second Mike McCurry told the crowd no tweeting and no participating in the Pizza Hut challenge
Inside the debate hall, members of the presidential debate commission are admonishing the crowd behind the group of undecideds to keep quiet
@BarackObama's limo is parked and he is headed into the building at Hofstra University for Round Two with Romney.
It's on. @BarackObama has left the hotel and is on his way to the debate site.
Obama is doing last minute debate prep this afternoon, then hanging with friends. Dinner with Michelle tonight: steak and potatoes.
Big news flash: @BarackObama had pasta with chicken for lunch

@BarackObama and motorcade have arrived at Hofstra University to do a walk-through of the debate environs.
@BarackObama has arrived in NY for the second debate and boarded his helicopter, en route to the debate site.

@BarackObama just made a surprise stop to vire the Hoover Dam.

Carney says: when you're president of the United States, you're president for everybody.
Obama tells Columbus, Ohio crowd: "I've got a lot of fight in me right now."
@BarackObama says he's done his own taxes, not sure if that can be said about the other guys
@BarackObama in Ohio tells crowd they should be having a picnic. Who's got the chicken, he asks. Then, naturally: who said 'beer'?
Correction: crowd in West Palm Beech was singing along to Al Green's "Let's Stay together. Was a nice moment for the campaign.
#Obama continues arithmetic theme in West Palm Beach, tells Repubs "no recess for you" for bad math on Medicare
Crowd waiting for @BarackObama in West Palm Beach is singing along to to Tina Turner's "Let's stay together."
@BarackObama making campaign calls in Florida http://t.co/WHK71fvF
Obama calls a volunteer, can't get him on the phone, so tries another number. Says Barney, the man on the phone, didn't believe it was him.
@BarackObama is stopping at a campaign office to make calls. After fiddling with an iPhone, he notes that he still has a Blackberry
@RachelSB Photos should be on the wire shortly
@JackVanD Obama bought pizza, so guess that counts
Maybe this will help with white guy voters? Enthusiastic, big-muscled white male pizza place owner literally just lifted Obama in the air
Alert, Potus makes a birth certificate joke! Told that a little boy was from Hawaii, Obama asks: "Do you have a birth certificate?"
It wouldn't be an Obama bus trip without a stop for beer. @BarackObama is enjoying a brew at Gator's Dockside in Florida.
The indoor venues are working well for Obama. This crowd is very hyped up, and Potus is drinking it in. The press likes the airconditioning.
Obama in Florida: Romney said it was tragic how I ended the war in Iraq. "Well, I did it anyway."
@antiimbeciles Hey Lev. Potus stands for President Of The United States. Its a code word his staff, secret service, and many others use.
@BarackObama and First Lady Michelle waving from AF1 before departing Charlottte after Dem convention. http://t.co/EvrZQ1GQ
After a sweaty morning workout at the hotel, @BarackObama hits the trail today in New Hampshire, Iowa, Florida. Swing state tour time.
@barakat_sara Different vantages points then. From the balcony view, while Obama and family were hugging, the crowd seemed unsure what to do
@saquin it wasn't pouring near potus's hotel, no. Heard some thunder at one point though
@BarackObama motorcade heading back to the hotel now, no lingering for confetti and after parties at the arena
Crowd seems unusually subdued at the end of Obama's speech.
Flotus and the girls just left their seats to go backstage. Obama must be wrapping up.
Potus has arrived at the Time Warnerr Cable Arena for his biggest speech of the campaign. The weather outside, by the way, is beautiful.
After a day at his hotel working on his big speech, @BarackObama is en route to the arena for the Democratic convention
Just saw a yawn in the audience. Clinton's speech length so far according to this reporter's tape recorder: 45 minutes
Members of DNC crowd shout "liar!" about Romney/Ryan when Clinton talks about Republican ads about welfare reform
Crowd erupts to its feet when Clinton amswers question: are we better off than we were four years ago?
Bill Clinton just ad-libbed the line on liking the signal about democracy that Obama and Hillary Clinton's friendly relationship sends
@wdcscribe not tonight is right
Can see the TelePrompter from the press pool's vantage point. Bill Clinton is following his text pretty closely.
Potus' press pool is standing behind the stage at the DNC on a balcony. In the hall at least, Elizabeth Warren was hard to hear
@BarackObama has arrived at Time Warner Cable Arena
@BarackObama motorcade has left the hotel
@BarackObama will be in the convention hall tonight to watch the Clinton speech, a campaign official says
With stadium event off, @BarackObama team says there were 65000 ticket holders & 19000 on waitlist. Last week they wouldn't release numbers.
AF1 taking off now with @BarackObama to @dnc2012 in Charlotte, rain and all.
Sheets of rain pouring down on Air Force One. We're now waiting on the runway, not taxiing anymore, perhaps to wait it out.
@davidaxelrod and david plouffe -- the designers of @BarackObama's 2008 campaign -- are on AF1 today for his ride to the DNC in Charlotte
Flotus: for Barack, success isn't about how much money you make but the difference you make in other people's lives
Michelle Obama: the truth matters. (Expect to hear this a lot from Dems in the coming days.)
Michelle Obama talks about growing up in a family without a lot of wealth or material things. Contrasting with the Romneys...
Flotus is getting a rock star's welcome at the DNC
Axe says says Dems will mention Bush next week as often as Repubs did at their convention this week (not much)
David Axelrod says the fact that Romney gave a 45-minute speech without noting he was governor of Massachusetts was a telling fact
Awkward?
Sounds like Paul Ryan was assigned to make Mormonism palatable for evangelicals, noting he & Romney go to different churches but share faith
Paul Ryan manages to get two swing states into his childhood story: growing up in Wisconsin (check) and going to college in Ohio (check)
Chris Christie says "tonight we're going to choose respect over love." This comes after Ann Romney made "love"  centerpiece of her speech
Ann Romney talks about her first apartment with Mitt. In a basement. With an ironing board.
Ann Romney expresses hope that no lives -- or property -- are lost from Hurricane Isaac.
Newish line in Obama's stump speech on this trip to Iowa/Colorado: "Denying climate change doesn't make it stop."
Obama sneezes, then says it gives him a cold just thinking what Republicans will do if they win the White House
Obama says Mitt Romney needs tax cuts even less than he does.
"Don't boo, vote!" Obama says when CO crowd shows displeasure at mention of Republican convention. Not the first time he's used that line.
After being interrupted by a protester in Nevada, Obama says: that young man probably needed a good teacher. It's teacher day on the trail.
Obama says Romney has more friends than he does who can write $10 million checks for the campaign
Obama jokes that he won't take questions from a man wearing a Green Bay Packers T-Shirt. Says he only interacts with Packers people in WI
Obama makes a surprise visit at an Iowa high school, is taking questions from teachers here. Teachers seem a bit awed.
Obama is visiting the Iowa State Fair
Obama says Republicans are not constrained by the facts when making political ads.
"Nice T-shirt!" Obama tells a boy wearing a shirt with the president's image on it
Obama is making a stop at a sno cone stand in Denison Iowa. Kinda like "shave ice" in Hawaii, minus the beans at the bottom of the cone.
Obama cals Paul Ryan a good family man, welcomes him to the race. Says he is a good spokesman for Romney's vision -- which he opposes.
Obama calls Hillary Clinton aide Huma Abedin an American patriot. Rep. Michele Bachman had suggested she was tied to the Muslim Brotherhood.
My grandmother would be proud, he notes. Obama had taken shoes off to walk on the wrestling mats at the gym.
Obama points out to the press that he doesn't have any holes in his socks, when putting his shoes back on at Olympic facility.
Obama says gives a special shoutout to the women's soccer team for avenging the loss at the World Cup
For the culinary experts out there, the enchilada comes with chorizo and an egg on top.
